I would recommend both "Creepshow" and "Doctor Zhivago". "Creepshow" is a classic horror film that tells five gruesome tales from a kid's comic book about a murdered father rising from his grave, a bizarre meteor, a vengeful husband, a mysterious crate's occupant, and a plague of cockroaches. "Doctor Zhivago" is also a classic novel by Leo Tolstoy that tells the story of a man named Leo who lived in Russia at the time of World War I. Leo falls in love with an upper-class woman named Nedyoka Vronsky, who is married to another man named Vronsky. Leo and Nedyoka Vronsky develop a deep and passionate relationship, but this relationship is ultimately doomed by the fact that both Leo and Nedyoka Vronsky are involved in romantic relationships with other people.
I hope these recommendations are helpful!
